# GitHub Repository Setup Guide

This guide will help you complete the setup of your Awesome LLMOps repository on GitHub.

## üìù Add Repository Description

### Via GitHub Web Interface:

1. Go to https://github.com/pmady/llmops
2. Click the **‚öôÔ∏è Settings** icon (gear icon) next to "About" on the right sidebar
3. In the "Description" field, add:
   ```
   üöÄ The Ultimate Curated List of LLMOps Tools, Frameworks, and Resources - A comprehensive collection of the best tools for Large Language Model Operations
   ```
4. Check ‚úÖ "Use your repository description"
5. Click **Save changes**

### Via GitHub CLI (if installed):

```bash
gh repo edit pmady/llmops --description "üöÄ The Ultimate Curated List of LLMOps Tools, Frameworks, and Resources - A comprehensive collection of the best tools for Large Language Model Operations"
```

## üè∑Ô∏è Add Repository Topics

### Via GitHub Web Interface:

1. Go to https://github.com/pmady/llmops
2. Click the **‚öôÔ∏è Settings** icon (gear icon) next to "About" on the right sidebar
3. In the "Topics" field, add these topics (one at a time):

**Essential Topics:**
- `llmops`
- `llm`
- `large-language-models`
- `awesome-list`
- `machine-learning`
- `artificial-intelligence`
- `deep-learning`
- `mlops`

**Additional Topics:**
- `generative-ai`
- `ai-tools`
- `ml-tools`
- `model-serving`
- `model-training`
- `prompt-engineering`
- `vector-database`
- `rag`
- `langchain`
- `openai`
- `huggingface`
- `inference`
- `fine-tuning`
- `observability`
- `ai-security`

4. Click **Save changes**

### Via GitHub CLI (if installed):

```bash
gh repo edit pmady/llmops --add-topic llmops,llm,large-language-models,awesome-list,machine-learning,artificial-intelligence,deep-learning,mlops,generative-ai,ai-tools,ml-tools,model-serving,model-training,prompt-engineering,vector-database,rag,langchain,openai,huggingface,inference,fine-tuning,observability,ai-security
```

## üåê Add Website URL (Optional)

If you want to add a website URL:

1. In the same "About" settings
2. Add website: `https://github.com/pmady/llmops`
3. Click **Save changes**

## ‚úÖ Enable Features

In the "About" settings, make sure these are checked:
- ‚úÖ Releases
- ‚úÖ Packages
- ‚úÖ Deployments (if applicable)

## üìä Social Preview Image (Optional)

To make your repo stand out when shared:

1. Go to **Settings** ‚Üí **Options**
2. Scroll to "Social preview"
3. Upload a custom image (1280x640px recommended)
   - You can create one with your repo name and description
   - Use tools like Canva, Figma, or Photoshop

## üéØ Additional Optimizations

### Enable Discussions (Optional)
1. Go to **Settings** ‚Üí **Features**
2. Check ‚úÖ "Discussions"
3. This allows community discussions

### Add Repository Metadata
1. Go to **Settings** ‚Üí **Options**
2. Set default branch to `main` (already done)
3. Enable "Automatically delete head branches" for cleaner PR workflow

### Pin Repository
1. Go to your profile: https://github.com/pmady
2. Click "Customize your pins"
3. Select `llmops` repository
4. This will feature it prominently on your profile

## üöÄ Promote Your Repository

### Submit to Awesome Lists
- [awesome-awesome](https://github.com/sindresorhus/awesome) - Submit a PR
- [awesome-llm](https://github.com/Hannibal046/Awesome-LLM) - Submit a PR

### Share on Social Media
- Twitter/X: "Just launched Awesome LLMOps üöÄ - A comprehensive curated list of 200+ tools for Large Language Model Operations. Check it out! #LLMOps #AI #MachineLearning https://github.com/pmady/llmops"
- LinkedIn: Share with a professional post
- Reddit: r/MachineLearning, r/artificial, r/LangChain
- Hacker News: Submit to Show HN

### Engage with Community
- Star related repositories
- Comment on relevant issues
- Share in LLM/AI Discord servers and Slack channels

## üìà Track Your Progress

Monitor your repository's growth:
- Stars: https://github.com/pmady/llmops/stargazers
- Forks: https://github.com/pmady/llmops/network/members
- Traffic: https://github.com/pmady/llmops/graphs/traffic (requires owner access)

## ‚ú® Verification

After completing the setup, verify:
- [ ] Description is visible on the repository page
- [ ] Topics are displayed below the description
- [ ] Repository appears in topic searches (e.g., search "topic:llmops")
- [ ] Social preview looks good when sharing links
- [ ] All documentation files are accessible
